title: Mexico president tests positive for coronavirus for 3rd time
description: Mexico’s president has suspended a tour of the Yucatan peninsula after acknowledging he tested positive for the cornavirus, having previously suffered two bouts of COVID-19

title: Canada suspends consular services in Sudan amid crisis
description: Canada has suspended its consular services in Sudan, saying a rapidly deteriorating situation has made it impossible to safeguard the safety and security of its staff in the capital city of Khartoum

title: 3,000 migrants begin walk north from southern Mexico
description: Around 3,000 migrants have begun what they call a mass protest procession through southern Mexico to demand the end of detention centers like the one that caught fire last month, killing 40 people

title: Jordan: Israel arrested lawmaker on arms-smuggling charges
description: Jordan’s Foreign Ministry says a Jordanian lawmaker has been arrested by Israel on suspicion of smuggling weapons and gold into the occupied West Bank

title: Sudan slides toward civil war and state collapse
description: People who have navigated Sudan’s tortured politics fear an even darker turn in a nation that is no stranger to ruinous war.

title: Peru's ex-president returned home to face corruption charges
description: Former President Alejandro Toledo has arrived in Lima after being extradited from the United States to face charges he allegedly received millions of dollars in bribes in a giant corruption scandal that has ensnared four of Peru’s ex-presidents

title: Indian climber pulled from crevasse in Nepal improving
description: An Indian climber who was rescued after spending three days in a 980-foot-deep Nepalese crevasse is recovering in a Kathmandu hospital but his condition is still critical

title: Indian police arrest Sikh separatist after month-long hunt
description: The chase for Amritpal Singh had led to a heavy police crackdown, invoking memories of an intense 1980s insurgency in Punjab.

title: 21 bodies dug up in cult investigation of pastor in Kenya
description: Police say 21 bodies have been discovered so far on land owned by a pastor in coastal Kenya who was arrested for telling his followers to fast to death

title: Prince William’s American relatives: A Revolution soldier, a legendary spy
description: Prince William is part American through his mother, the late Princess Diana, records show. The family traces to the Revolution — and rebels against the crown.

title: Suspect arrested in German gym attack that left 4 wounded
description: Authorities say a man has been arrested over last week’s stabbing attack at a gym in the western German city of Duisburg in which four people were seriously wounded

title: Governments race to rescue diplomats, citizens from Sudan
description: The U.S. military has airlifted embassy officials out of Sudan and international governments were racing to evacuate thousands of their diplomatic staff and citizens trapped in the capital

title: Train hits car at crossing in Germany, 3 killed
description: Police say a train has hit a car at a crossing in northern Germany, killing all three people in the car

title: Wrexham levels up: What to know about the celebrity-owned soccer club
description: The team in Wales, purchased by actors Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney two years ago, is champion of the fifth tier of English soccer.

title: Wagner group surges in Africa as U.S. influence fades, leak reveals
description: THE DISCORD LEAKS | Wagner’s influence in Africa is a source of alarm to the U.S., prompting a push to find ways to hit the group, according to the documents.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russian foreign minister heads to U.N.; Moscow to oust German diplomats
description: Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will meet U.N. Secretary General António Guterres in New York. Russia holds the rotating presidency of the U.N. Security Council.

title: In Bakhmut, Ukrainian troops cling to western edge of a destroyed city
description: The longest, bloodiest battle of the war now involves close combat on the streets and between apartment blocks Russia and Ukraine continue to pour in reinforcements. into Bakhmut.

title: U.S. forces evacuate diplomats from Sudan as embassy suspends operations
description: Fighting between rival armed groups in the Horn of Africa country has killed at least 400 people and injured 3,500, according to the United Nations.
